title: Audio not playing on certain websites
content: Hello, when I am on Firefox I am unable to play audio from websites such as Reddit,Twitter and other sites but I am able to do so in youtube. This does not happen to me in other browsers such as brave/edge. Things I have tried are refreshing firefox, turning off extensions, installing windows media pack, trying a different sound device, adjusting sound mixer, allowing autoplay, update drivers. This started happening after I did a clean install of windows. Any help would be appreciated.

title: Thunderbird will not reinstall in my win 11 computer
content: I recently bought a new computer and Installed Thunderbird. It worked fine. Then one day it would not start up, i got a message that a copy of Thunderbird is running and I should close it. I clicked the close button and the same message kept reappearing. It never could close. I tried uninstalling Thunderbird, it would not install and I kept getting the same message. How can I fix this and install a new copy of Thunderbird? Do I have to erase some registry?

title: Firefox not "seeing" video thumbnails hosted on Kajabi
content:

Sounds like a firefox glitch but I can't figure out which setting to change...if it is a settings issue. Any suggestions are appreciated. Thanks

title: Please add a bookmarks icon to address bar.
content: I am tired of clicking and scrolling and clicking and scrolling to find something I use constantly. It's fine to bury "settings" in a menu because I only use it once or twice. But things that we constantly use daily should be prominently displayed front and center. When I make a user interface I always make the daily use items as easy as possible. Rare use items can be hidden away in a submenu because it will only rarely irritate users, and in fact, if it can be destructive, it should be buried deep in the menu tree so you don't click it by accident.
creator: ericcanzler

title: Firefox hanging / crashing all of a sudden?
content:
I'm not sure when this 136.0.1 update happened but starting today, firefox has been crashing all day. The symptom when I see it is I can't get to a website I then go over to the the help desk (open in firefox), which auto refreshes every couple minutes, is spinning (not updating). If I open a new instance the UI never completely loads. When I close things, then try to open, it says firefox already running and if to quit, yes, and just no UI completely loads. In the end, it will only start working again if I reboot. Several reports were sent to microsoft (the automatic notifying microsoft of issue).

I tried disabling all plugins and same thing still happens.

I do know the helpdesk website had a new certificate installed yesterday. Not sure if that has anything to do with it. It's not like firefox doesn't work when first bringing it up, it works for a while then all of a sudden doesn't? and then starts crashing.

Is anyone else having an issue with the latest version on Win10 x64 using the x64 version of FireFox?

I'm using chrome right now since it just crashed again in "not responding" state. I'd rather stay with FireFox.
creator: dfatff
